DOC.brief_summary: The objective present study compare neuromechanical response spinal manipulation spinal mobilization participant without chronic nonspecific back pain .
DOC.brief_title: Spinal Manipulation Spinal Mobilization Effects Participants With Without Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Although evidence suggest similar effectiveness spinal manipulation spinal mobilization , study compare neuromechanical effect manual therapy experimental context standardization intervention . Therefore , objective present study compare neuromechanical response spinal manipulation ( low-amplitude high-velocity dynamic thrust ) spinal mobilization ( repetition low-amplitude low-velocity nonthrust movement ) participant without chronic nonspecific back pain .
DOC.criteria: present history chronic nonspecific back pain History back trauma surgery Severe osteoarthritis Inflammatory arthritis Vascular condition Contraindication use spinal manipulation spinal mobilization Pregnancy Scoliosis
